name: User want to submit leave until submit leave quota is exhausted
scenarioId: classpath:features/orangehrm/orangehrm_submit_leave_with_notes:User want to submit leave until submit leave quota is exhausted
methodName: User want to submit leave until submit leave quota is exhausted

testSteps.description: 1: User want to submit leave until submit leave quota is exhausted ({current_balance=23.00 Day(s), expected_balance=22.00 Day(s), selected_date=1, leave_comments=submit leave due to flu and diarrhea})

children.description: Given Sergey wants access HRM Dashboard with admin credentials via login
Sergey opens the Orange HRM login page
Sergey opens the Orange hrm login page
Sergey do login on orange hrm with credentials 'Admin' and password 'admin123'
Sergey enters 'Admin' into username text field
Sergey enters 'admin123' into password text field
Sergey clicks on button login
When he wants to submit his leave and his current leave balance is "23.00 Day(s)" on selected date "1" with comments "submit leave due to flu and diarrhea"
he access sidebar - leave page
he clicks on dashboard page sidebar - Leave
he should see Page title - Leave that is displayed
he try to submit leave
he clicks on topbar menu - Apply
he should see sub page title - Apply Leave that is displayed
he should see input type - leave type that is displayed
he clicks on input type - leave type
he should see dropdown appear from leave type that is displayed
he should see 1st leave type dropdown list that is displayed
he should see 2nd leave type dropdown list that is displayed
he clicks on 2nd leave type dropdown list
he should see input type - leave type with text value that is equal to: <"CAN - FMLA">
he should see Current leave quota with text value that is equal to: <"23.00 Day(s)">
he should see input calendar - from date that is displayed
he clicks on input calendar - from date
he should see component calendar that is displayed
he should see current designated date that is displayed
he clicks on current designated date
he should see input box comments that is displayed
he enters 'submit leave due to flu and diarrhea' into input box comments
Then he should submit his leave successfully and his leave balance should be reduced by -1 into "22.00 Day(s)"
he should see button apply leave that is displayed
he clicks on button apply leave
he should see text apply success that is displayed
he assert leave balance after submitting leave for 1 daye
he should see input type - leave type that is displayed
he clicks on input type - leave type
he should see dropdown appear from leave type that is displayed
he should see 1st leave type dropdown list that is displayed
he should see 2nd leave type dropdown list that is displayed
he clicks on 2nd leave type dropdown list
he should see input type - leave type with text value that is equal to: <"CAN - FMLA">
he should see Current leave quota that is displayed
he should see Current leave quota with text value that is equal to: <"22.00 Day(s)">
And he should see that his submitted leave has been recored on My Leave section and check that the status should be correct by "submit leave due to flu and diarrhea"
he should see topbar menu - My Leave that is displayed
he clicks on topbar menu - My Leave
he should see sub page title - My Leave that is displayed
he should see current designated leave comments that is displayed

userStory.storyName: Orange HRM Submit Leave with comments
userStory.displayName: Orange HRM Submit Leave with comments

title: User want to submit leave until submit leave quota is exhausted

values: submit leave due to flu and diarrhea

dataTable.scenarioOutline:
Given Sergey wants access HRM Dashboard with admin credentials via login
When he wants to submit his leave and his current leave balance is "<current_balance>" on selected date "<selected_date>" with comments "<leave_comments>"
Then he should submit his leave successfully and his leave balance should be reduced by -1 into "<expected_balance>"
And he should see that his submitted leave has been recored on My Leave section and check that the status should be correct by "<leave_comments>"
